opennlp.ccg.parse.postagger.ml
Class POSTagFex

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.parse.postagger.ml.POSTagFex
All Implemented Interfaces:
FeatureExtractor
public class POSTagFex
extends Object
implements FeatureExtractor

Feature extractor for POS taggers. The inputs are "TaggedWord"s simply for consistency of interface. There should be no tags assigned to the words (short, perhaps, TOBI tags or the like).

Author:
Dennis N. Mehay

Method Detail

getFeatures

public Collection<Pair<String,Double>> getFeatures(Map<Integer,TaggedWord> sentence,
                                                   Integer wordIndex)
Get a word's features for applying the tagger (i.e., not training mode).

Specified by:
getFeatures in interface FeatureExtractor
Parameters:
sentence - A Map<Integer,Word> giving the (string-indexed) sentence of Words to be tagged.
wordIndex - An Integer, giving the string index of the current word.
Returns:
A Collection<Pair<String,Double>><String> representing the real-valued activations of features (predicates) in the context of a word to be labelled.

getSentenceFeatures

Get a sentence of words' features for applying the tagger (i.e., not training mode).

Specified by:
getSentenceFeatures in interface FeatureExtractor

getFeatures

public Collection<Pair<String,Double>> getFeatures(Map<Integer,TaggedWord> sentence,
                                                   Integer wordIndex,
                                                   boolean training)
Get the features for a word in context. training == true iff the output class is to be collected as well. TODO: This and supertagger feature extractor (fex) should be merged into a more general, parameterizable sentence-level contextual feature extractor. (VERY todo-ish, though.)

Specified by:
getFeatures in interface FeatureExtractor
Parameters:
sentence - A Map giving the (string-indexed) sentence of Words to be tagged.
wordIndex - An Integer, giving the string index of the current word.
training - A boolean indicating whether we are extracting features for training (in which case we need the label too).
Returns:
A Collection> representing the real-valued activations of features (predicates) in the context of a word to be labelled.

getSentenceFeatures

public List<Collection<Pair<String,Double>>> getSentenceFeatures(Map<Integer,TaggedWord> sentence,
                                                                 boolean training)
Get the features for a sentence of words in context. training == true iff the output classes are to be collected as well.
